title: Angelina Jolie interviewed by Amanda Holden’s 7-year-old daughter
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Amanda Holden took along her young daughter Hollie to interview Angelina Jolie and Elle Fanning on the Maleficent trail and is it possible to be jealous of a seven-year-old?

Of course we got our moment with Angelina last week as she touched down in London for the premiere of her latest Disney flick, Mistress Of Evil, but this is just beyond.

Wanting to share with her the perks of being in her position, Amanda took her daughter along to a press junket last week.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Sitting in front of Angelina (who plays Maleficent) and Elle (Princess Aurora), young Hollie didn’t look even a smidge star struck, as she happily asked questions of the Hollywood stars.

Angelina and Elle looked to be loving their chat with Hollie (Picture: Heart)

Take your daughter to work day (Picture: Heart)

‘Do you think there is good and bad in everyone?’ she read off a cue card, as a proud Amanda watched on with a smile on her face.

‘I think bad is usually people who are afraid and they do bad things, but they’re not strong people, those people,’ Angelina answered diplomatically.

‘And good people are usually very strong people.’

Amanda interviewed the megastars for her Heart Radio show, taking to Twitter with the video and caption that read: ‘@disneymaleficent film stars #AngelinaJolie and #ElleFanning chat to Heart❤

‘.@noholdenback’s #Maleficent super-fan daughter Hollie helps mummy Amanda interview the A-listers!!’

As they then mulled over whether Princess Aurora should have married ‘one of those cute, little fairy folk’ or a dark fae, it was then asked if both Elle and Ange could rid the world of anything, what it would be.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Probably say hate,’ Elle said, as Angeline added: ‘Judgement, there are people who judge without knowing the full story.’

Taking the reins for the final question, Amanda asked Angelina in particular how important it was for her to play roles ‘that gently give a message to younger people’.

‘When you know a large part of the audience is young, I think usually it’s the adults that need to be reminded of these messages,’ Angelina said.

She added: ‘The message that family is not just blood, you know, half of my children are not my blood but they are absolutely my family and my children and I love them so much.

‘It’s very important to understand there are lots of different ways to have family.’

Angelina shares six children with ex-husband Brad Pitt, adopted children Maddox, 18, Pax, 15 and Zahara, 14, as well we biological children Shiloh, 13, and twins Knox and Vivienne, 11.

Tune in to Heart Breakfast with Jamie Theakston and Amanda Holden, weekdays from 6.30am–10am.

Maleficent is in cinemas 18 October.
